1.verse: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

2.verse: As it is written in Isaiah the prophet, “Behold, I am sending my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way,

3.verse: a voice calling out in the wilderness: ‘Prepare the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.’”

4.verse: John the baptizer appeared in the wilderness and began preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

5.verse: And all the Judean countryside and all Jerusalem were going out to him and were being baptized by him in the Jordan river, confessing their sins.

6.verse: Now John was clothed with camel’s hair with a leather belt around his waist, and he fed on locusts and wild honey.

7.verse: And he was proclaiming, saying, “The one who is more powerful than I is coming after me; of whom I am not worthy to stoop down and untie the thong of his sandals.

8.verse: I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”

9.verse: Now in those days Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee and was baptized in the Jordan River by John.

10.verse: And just as he was coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens opening up and the Spirit as a dove descending on him.

11.verse: Then a voice came from heaven, “You are my beloved Son; in you I take delight.”

12.verse: At once the Spirit drove him out into the wilderness,

13.verse: and he was in the wilderness for forty days, being tempted by Satan. He was there with the wild beasts, and the angels were ministering to him.

14.verse: Now after John had been taken into custody, Jesus went into Galilee, proclaiming the gospel of God,

15.verse: and saying, “The time is fulfilled and the kingdom of God is at hand; repent and believe in the gospel.”

16.verse: As Jesus was going alongside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew, the brother of Simon, casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.

17.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Come, follow me, and I will make you become fishers of men.”

18.verse: And immediately they left their nets and followed him.

19.verse: And going on a little farther, he saw James the son of Zebedee and John his brother, who also were in their boat mending nets.

20.verse: And immediately he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.

21.verse: Then they went to Capernaum; and on the next Sabbath Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.

22.verse: And they were astonished at his teaching, for he was teaching them as one having authority, and not as their scribes.

23.verse: Suddenly there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit, and he cried out,

24.verse: saying, “What do you have to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!”

25.verse: But Jesus rebuked it, saying, “Be quiet and come out of him!”

26.verse: Then the unclean spirit threw the man into convulsions, cried out with a loud voice, and came out of him.

27.verse: All the people were amazed, so that they asked among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching with authority! He even gives orders to unclean spirits and they obey him.”

28.verse: And his fame spread quickly everywhere throughout all the country round about Galilee.

29.verse: As soon as they went out of the synagogue they went to the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.

30.verse: Now the mother-in-law of Simon lay sick with a fever, and without delay they spoke to Jesus about her.

31.verse: So he came and raised her up, taking her by the hand. Then the fever left her, and she began to wait on them.

32.verse: When evening came, after the sun had gone down, people were bringing to him all who were sick as well as the demon-possessed.

33.verse: And the entire city was gathered together at the door.

34.verse: So he healed many who were sick with various diseases, and drove out many demons. But he would not permit the demons to speak, because they knew him.

35.verse: Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus arose, left the house and went out to a deserted place; and there he spent time in prayer.

36.verse: And Simon and those who were with him searched for him,

37.verse: found him, and said to him, “Everyone is looking for you.”

38.verse: And he said to them, “Let us go elsewhere, into the nearby towns, so that I may preach there also, because that is what I came to do.”

39.verse: So he traveled throughout all Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.

40.verse: And a leper came to him, pleading for help from him, and falling on his knees he exclaimed to him, “If you are willing, you can make me clean!”

41.verse: Moved with compassion, Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him, saying to him, “I am willing; be made clean.”

42.verse: And at once the leprosy left him and he was cleansed.

43.verse: And after sternly warning him, Jesus sent him away at once,

44.verse: and said to him, “See that you say nothing to anyone, but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”

45.verse: However, he went out and began to announce it publicly and spread abroad the news, so that Jesus could no longer openly enter a town, but stayed out in unpopulated areas. Yet people kept coming to him from every quarter.

1.verse: And when, after several days, Jesus had returned to Capernaum, it was reported that he was at home.

2.verse: Many people gathered so that there was no longer any room, not even at the entrance; and he began speaking the word to them.

3.verse: And some men came, bringing to him a paralytic carried by four of them.

4.verse: When they were not able to carry him in because of the crowd, they broke through the roof above Jesus, and when they had dug out an opening, they lowered the mat on which the paralytic was lying.

5.verse: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, “My son, your sins are forgiven.”

6.verse: Now some of the scribes were sitting there, reasoning in their hearts,

7.verse: “Why does this man speak like that? It is blasphemy! Who can forgive sins except the One God?”

8.verse: And Jesus, knowing immediately in his spirit that they were reasoning in that way within themselves, said to them, “Why are you contemplating these things in your hearts?

9.verse: Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven,’ or to say, ‘Get up, pick up your mat, and walk’?

10.verse: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on the earth to forgive sins”—he said to the paralytic,

11.verse: “I say to you, get up, pick up your mat, and go to your home.”

12.verse: And immediately the man got up, picked up his mat, and went out in full view of them all, so they were all amazed and praised God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this!”

13.verse: Once again Jesus went out alongside the lake. A large crowd was coming to him, and he was teaching them.

14.verse: As he was walking along, he saw Levi, the son of Alphaeus, sitting at the tax booth, and he said to him, “Follow me.” So Levi got up and followed him.

15.verse: And as he reclined at table in Levi’s house, many tax collectors and sinners were reclining with Jesus and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.

16.verse: And the scribes of the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with sinners and tax collectors, said to his disciples, “Why is he eating with tax collectors and sinners?”

17.verse: When Jesus heard this he said to them, “Those who are in good health have no need of a doctor, but those who are physically ill. I have not come to call the pious, but sinners, to repentance.”

18.verse: The disciples of John and of the Pharisees were fasting. Some people came and said to him, “Why do the disciples of John and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?”

19.verse: And Jesus said to them, “Do the friends of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them? No, as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they do not fast.

20.verse: But days will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and then they will fast in that day.

21.verse: “No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. If he does, the patch pulls away from it, the new from the old, and the tear becomes worse.

22.verse: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the wine will burst the skins and the wine will be wasted as well as the skins. But new wine is poured into fresh wineskins.”

23.verse: It happened that on the Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and his disciples began to make their way along, plucking heads of grain.

24.verse: So the Pharisees said to him, “Look, why are they doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”

25.verse: He said to them, “Have you never read what David did when he was in need and became hungry, he and those who were with him?

26.verse: How he went into the house of God when Abiathar was high priest and ate the sacred bread, which is not lawful to eat, except for the priests, and he also gave it to those who were with him?”

27.verse: And he said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.

28.verse: So the Son of Man is lord even of the Sabbath.”

1.verse: Jesus entered again into a synagogue, and a man with a withered hand was there.

2.verse: And they were watching him carefully to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath, so they could accuse him.

3.verse: And he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Get up and step forward.”

4.verse: And he said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to destroy it?” But they remained silent.

5.verse: And after looking around at them in anger, grieved at the hardness of their heart, he said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched out his hand and it was restored.

6.verse: So the Pharisees went out immediately and began plotting with Herodians against him, as to how they might do away with him.

7.verse: But Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the lake, and there followed a large crowd from Galilee and from Judea,

8.verse: and from Jerusalem, and from Idumea and beyond the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon a large crowd came to him when they heard about the things he had done.

9.verse: And he told his disciples to make ready a small boat for him because of the crowd, so that they would not crush him.

10.verse: For he had healed many, so that all who had diseases were pressing around him so they could touch him.

11.verse: And the unclean spirits, whenever they saw him, fell down before him and cried out, saying, “You are the Son of God!”

12.verse: But he warned them repeatedly not to make him known.

13.verse: And he went up into the mountain and called those whom he himself wanted, and they came to him.

14.verse: And he appointed twelve (whom he also named apostles) so that they might be with him and so that he might send them out to preach

15.verse: and have authority to drive out demons.

16.verse: He appointed the twelve: Peter (the name he gave to Simon);

17.verse: James the son of Zebedee, John the brother of James (he gave to them the name Boanerges, that is, Sons of Thunder);

18.verse: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Canaanite;

19.verse: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.

20.verse: Then Jesus went to his house, and again a crowd gathered, so that they were not even able to eat a meal.

21.verse: And when his family heard this, they went out to take charge of him, for people were saying, “He is out of his mind.”

22.verse: And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem were saying, “He has Beelzebul in him,” and “By the prince of demons he drives out demons.”

23.verse: So he called them together and began speaking to them in parables: “How can Satan drive out Satan?

24.verse: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

25.verse: And if a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

26.verse: And if Satan rises against himself and is divided, he cannot stand but is coming to an end.

27.verse: But no one can enter the house of the strong man and carry off his possessions unless first he ties up the strong man; then he can rob his house.

28.verse: “I tell you the truth, all things will be forgiven the sons of men, all sinful behavior and whatever blasphemies they may utter;

29.verse: but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not have forgiveness for all time, but is guilty of an eternal sin”

30.verse: because he said, “He has an unclean spirit.”

31.verse: Then his mother and his brothers came, and standing outside they sent word to him, calling for him.

32.verse: And a crowd was sitting around him, and they said to him, “Look, your mother and your brothers are outside looking for you.”

33.verse: And he responded to them, saying, “Who is my mother and who are my brothers?”

34.verse: And looking around at those who were sitting around him in a circle, he said, “Here are my mother and my brothers!

35.verse: For whoever does the will of God, this one is my brother and my sister and my mother.”

1.verse: Again Jesus began to teach beside the lake. And a very large crowd gathered about him, so that he got into a boat and sat there out on the lake while all the people were on shore by the edge of the water.

2.verse: And he taught them many things by parables, and in his teaching said to them:

3.verse: “Listen! A sower went out to sow.

4.verse: And as he was sowing, some seed fell along the path, and birds came and ate it up.

5.verse: Other seed fell on rocky ground where it did not have much soil, and it sprang up right away because it had no depth of soil.

6.verse: When the sun came up, the plant was scorched, and because it did not have a root, it withered away.

7.verse: Other seed fell among the thorns, and the thorns came up and choked it, and it did not produce grain.

8.verse: But other seed fell into good soil and produced grain, sprouting, growing, and bearing thirty, sixty, and even a hundredfold.”

9.verse: And he said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him listen!”

10.verse: When he was alone, those around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.

11.verse: And he said to them, “To you has been given the mystery of the kingdom of God, but to those outside, everything is in parables,

12.verse: so that ‘when they look, they may see yet not perceive, and when they listen, they may hear yet not understand; otherwise they might turn and be forgiven.’”

13.verse: And he said to them, “Do you not understand this parable? Then how will you understand all the parables?

15.verse: These are the ones on the path where the word is sown: whenever they hear, Satan immediately comes and carries off the word that was sown in them.

16.verse: These are the ones sown on rocky ground: whenever they hear the word, they immediately receive it with joy.

17.verse: But they have no root in themselves and last for only a limited time. Then, when tribulation or persecution comes because of the word, immediately they fall away.

18.verse: Others are the ones sown among the thorns: these are the ones who hear the word,

19.verse: but the cares of the world, the deceitfulness of wealth, and the desires for many other things come in and choke the word, and it becomes barren.

20.verse: These are the ones sown on good soil: they hear the word, accept it, and bear fruit—thirty, sixty, and even a hundredfold.”

21.verse: And he said to them, “A lamp is not brought to be put under a basket or under a bed, is it? Is it not to be put on a lampstand?

22.verse: For nothing is hidden except to be disclosed; nor is anything concealed, except to come to light.

23.verse: If anyone has ears to hear, let him listen!”

24.verse: And he said to them, “Pay attention to what you hear. By what measure you measure it will be measured out to you, and more will be added to you.

25.verse: For whoever has, more will be given to him; and whoever does not have, even what he does have will be taken away from him.”

26.verse: And he said, “The kingdom of God is like a man who scatters seed on the ground.

27.verse: He goes to bed and gets up, night and day, and the seed sprouts and grows, although he does not know how.

28.verse: The soil produces a crop all by itself: first the stalk, then the head, then the full grain in the head.

29.verse: And when the grain is ripe, immediately he sends in the sickle, because the harvest has come.”

30.verse: Then he said, “To what can we compare the kingdom of God, or what parable can we use for it?

31.verse: It is like a mustard seed that, when it is sown in the ground, is smaller than all of the seeds on earth.

32.verse: Yet when it is sown, it grows up and becomes larger than all the garden plants and puts out large branches, so that the birds of the air are able to nest in its shade.”

33.verse: So with many parables such as these he spoke the word to them, as they were able to understand.

34.verse: And without a parable he did not speak to them; but privately to his own disciples he would explain everything.

35.verse: On that same day, when evening had come, he said to them, “Let us go over to the other side.”

36.verse: So after leaving the crowd, they took him with them, just as he was, in the boat. And other boats were with him.

37.verse: Now a fierce windstorm arose and the waves began to break into the boat, so that the boat was now filling.

38.verse: But Jesus was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. They woke him and said to him, “Teacher, do you not care that we are perishing?”

39.verse: So he got up and rebuked the wind and said to the sea, “Be still! Settle down!” Then the wind died down and there was a great calm.

40.verse: And he said to them, “Why are you so fearful? Have you still no faith?”

41.verse: And they were filled with great fear and said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

1.verse: So they went to the other side of the lake to the region of the Gerasenes.

2.verse: And just as Jesus got out of the boat, there met him from the tombs a man with an unclean spirit.

3.verse: He had his dwelling among the tombs, and no one could bind him any longer, not even with a chain.

4.verse: For he had often been bound with shackles and chains, but the chains were torn apart by him and the shackles broken in pieces, and no one was strong enough to subdue him.

5.verse: Unceasingly, night and day among the tombs and in the mountains, he kept crying out and cutting himself with stones.

6.verse: But when he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and bowed down before him.

7.verse: Crying out in a loud voice, he exclaimed, “What have you to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? Swear to God that you will not torment me!”

8.verse: (For Jesus had said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”)

9.verse: And Jesus asked him, “What is your name?” He said to him, “Legion is my name, for we are many.”

10.verse: And he kept begging him earnestly not to send them out of the region.

11.verse: Now a large herd of pigs was feeding there on the mountainside.

12.verse: And the unclean spirits begged him, saying, “Send us to the pigs so we can enter them.”

13.verse: So he gave them permission. Then the unclean spirits came out and entered the pigs. The herd (about two thousand strong) rushed down the steep bank into the sea and was drowned.

14.verse: Those tending the pigs fled and reported it in the village and throughout the countryside, and people came to see what had happened.

15.verse: They came to Jesus and saw the demon-possessed man, the one who had the legion, sitting, clothed and in his right mind, and they were afraid.

16.verse: And those who had seen it described to them what had happened to the demon-possessed man, and all about the pigs.

17.verse: Then they began to implore Jesus to depart from their region.

18.verse: As he was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed kept begging him to go with him.

19.verse: But he did not permit him. Instead, he said to him, “Go to your home, to your own people, and tell them how much the Lord has done for you and that he had mercy on you.”

20.verse: The man left and began to proclaim in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him; and everyone was amazed.

21.verse: When Jesus had crossed in a boat again to the other side, a large crowd gathered around him, and he was by the lake.

22.verse: Then one of the synagogue officials, Jairus by name, came there. When he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet

23.verse: and begged him earnestly, saying, “My little daughter is about to die. Come and place your hands on her so she will be healed and live.”

24.verse: So Jesus went with him. A large crowd was following him and crowding around him.

25.verse: And a woman was there who had had a discharge of blood for twelve years.

26.verse: She had suffered a great deal under the care of many doctors, and had spent all she had, yet it benefitted her nothing; rather she had grown worse.

27.verse: When she heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,

28.verse: for she had been saying, “If I can only touch his clothes, I will be healed.”

29.verse: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she knew in her body that she was healed of the affliction.

30.verse: And Jesus, knowing in himself that power had gone out from him, immediately turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched my clothes?”

31.verse: And his disciples said to him, “You see the crowd pressing around you and yet you say, ‘Who touched me?’”

32.verse: But he looked around to see the one who had done this.

33.verse: Then the woman, with fear and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before him and told him the whole truth.

34.verse: And he said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace and be healed of your affliction.”

35.verse: While he was still speaking, people came from the synagogue official, saying, “Your daughter has died. Why trouble the teacher any longer?”

36.verse: But Jesus, ignoring what was said, said to the synagogue official, “Do not be afraid; only believe.”

37.verse: And he did not permit anyone to follow him, except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.

38.verse: They came to the house of the synagogue official, and Jesus saw a commotion with people weeping and wailing loudly.

39.verse: Upon entering he said to them, “Why are you making such a commotion and weeping? The child has not died, but is sleeping.”

40.verse: And they began to ridicule him. But when he had put them all out, he took the father of the child and her mother and those who were with him and went in where the child was.

41.verse: And taking hold of the child’s hand, he said to her, “Talitha koum!” which is translated, “Little girl, I say to you, arise.”

42.verse: And the little girl got up at once and began to walk; for she was twelve years old. And immediately they were utterly amazed.

43.verse: And Jesus strictly ordered them that no one should know about this, and he told them that something to eat should be given to her.

1.verse: And Jesus left from there and went to his hometown, and his disciples followed him.

2.verse: And when the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue. And many, when they heard him, were astonished, saying, “Where does this man get these things? What wisdom has been given to him? How are such mighty works done through his hands?

3.verse: Is this man not the carpenter, the son of Mary and the brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? And are not his sisters here with us?” And they were deeply offended at him.

4.verse: And Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown, and among his relatives, and in his own household.”

5.verse: And he was not able to do any mighty work there, except that he laid his hands on a few sick people and healed them.

6.verse: And he was amazed at their lack of faith. And he went around among the villages teaching.

7.verse: And he called to himself the twelve and began to send them out two by two, and gave them authority over the unclean spirits.

8.verse: He instructed them to take nothing for their journey except simply a staff—no bread, no bag, no money in their belts—

9.verse: but to wear sandals. Then he added, “Do not put on two tunics.”

10.verse: And he said to them, “Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that area.

11.verse: And any place that does not receive you or listen to you, when you leave there, shake off the dust from under your feet as a witness against them.”

12.verse: So departing, they proclaimed that people should repent,

13.verse: and they drove out many demons. They anointed with oil many who were sick and healed them.

14.verse: King Herod heard about this, for Jesus’ name had become well known. Some were saying, “John the baptizer has been raised from the dead. That is why miraculous powers are at work in him.”

15.verse: But others were saying, “He is Elijah.” Still others were saying, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of old.”

16.verse: But when Herod heard this, he said, “He is John, the man I beheaded; he has been raised from the dead.”

17.verse: For it was Herod himself who had sent and arrested John and bound him in prison on account of Herodias, the wife of Philip his brother, because he had married her.

18.verse: For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have the wife of your brother.”

19.verse: So Herodias was nursing a grudge against him and wanted to kill him. But she was not able to do it,

20.verse: because Herod feared John, knowing him to be a just and holy man, and he protected him. When he heard him, he was greatly perplexed, yet he heard him gladly.

21.verse: Then an opportune day came when Herod on his birthday gave a banquet for his government officials, military commanders, and prominent men of Galilee.

22.verse: When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner companions. The king said to the young girl, “Ask me for whatever you wish, and I will give it to you.”

23.verse: And he promised her insistently with an oath, “Whatever you ask for, I will give it to you, up to half of my kingdom.”

24.verse: So she went out and said to her mother, “What should I ask for?” And her mother said, “The head of John the baptizer.”

25.verse: And immediately, entering with haste to the king, she asked him, saying, “I want you to give me right now the head of John the baptizer on a platter.”

26.verse: The king became very sad, but because of what he had promised with an oath, and because of his dinner guests, he did not want to refuse her request.

27.verse: So without delay the king dispatched the executioner and ordered him to bring John’s head. He went and beheaded John in prison,

28.verse: and brought his head on a platter and gave it to the young girl. The young girl in turn gave it to her mother.

29.verse: When John’s disciples heard of this, they came and took his corpse and placed it in a tomb.

30.verse: The apostles rejoined Jesus and reported to him all they had done and taught.

31.verse: And he said to them, “Come away by yourselves to some deserted place and rest a while.” For many were coming and going, and they did not even have a time to eat.

32.verse: So they left in a boat to a deserted place by themselves.

33.verse: Many people saw them leaving, recognized them, and hurried together on foot from all the towns and arrived there ahead of them.

34.verse: When Jesus got out of the boat, he saw the large crowd, and had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. And he began to teach them many things.

35.verse: As the hour grew late, his disciples came to him and said, “This is a deserted place and the hour is already late.

36.verse: Send them away so they can go into the surrounding hamlets and villages and buy for themselves something to eat.”

37.verse: But he answered them, saying, “You give them something to eat.” And they said to him, “Should we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give it to them to eat?”

38.verse: And he said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go and see.” When they found out they said, “Five—and two fish.”

39.verse: Then he ordered them to have all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.

40.verse: So they sat down in orderly groups of hundreds and fifties.

41.verse: And taking the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves and gave them to his disciples so they could distribute them. And he divided the two fish among them all.

42.verse: So they all ate and were filled.

43.verse: Then they picked up twelve baskets full of broken pieces and what was left of the fish.

44.verse: And those who had eaten the loaves were five thousand men.

45.verse: Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to the other side, toward Bethsaida, while he dispersed the crowd.

46.verse: After he had taken leave of them, he went to the mountain to pray.

47.verse: When evening had come, the boat was in the middle of the lake and he was alone on the land.

48.verse: He saw them straining at the oars, for the wind was against them. About the fourth watch of the night he came toward them, walking on the lake. He intended to pass by them,

49.verse: but when they saw him walking on the lake, they thought that he was a ghost. And they cried out,

50.verse: for they all saw him and were terrified. But immediately he spoke with them and said to them, “Take courage! It is I. Do not be afraid!”

51.verse: Then he got into the boat with them, and the wind died down. And they were absolutely amazed,

52.verse: for they did not understand about the loaves; but their heart was hardened.

53.verse: So when they had crossed over, they came to land at Gennesaret where they tied up the boat.

54.verse: When they got out of the boat, the people immediately recognized Jesus,

55.verse: ran throughout that whole area, and began to bring those who were ill on their mats to wherever they heard he was.

56.verse: And wherever he entered villages, towns, or rural areas, they would place the sick in the marketplaces and implore him that they might touch just the fringe of his cloak. And as many as touched him were made well.

1.verse: The Pharisees and some of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem gathered around Jesus

2.verse: and noticed that some of his disciples were eating the loaves with hands that were defiled, that is, unwashed.

3.verse: (For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they ceremonially wash their hands, thus maintaining the tradition of the elders.

4.verse: They do not eat anything from the marketplace unless it is purified by washing. And there are many other customs that they have received as tradition to keep, like the washing of cups, pots, copper bowls, and dining couches.)

5.verse: And the Pharisees and scribes asked him, “Why do your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with defiled hands?”

6.verse: And he said to them, “Isaiah prophesied accurately about you hypocrites, as it is written: ‘This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

7.verse: In vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrines the precepts of men.’

8.verse: Neglecting the command of God, you maintain the tradition of men.”

9.verse: And he said to them, “You are clever at setting aside the command of God in order to establish your own tradition.

10.verse: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘Whoever speaks evil of father or mother must be put to death.’

11.verse: But you say, ‘If a man says to his father or mother, “Whatever help you might have received from me is Corban” (that is, given to God),

12.verse: then you no longer allow him to do anything for his father or mother.

13.verse: Thus you invalidate the word of God with your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many similar things.”

14.verse: Calling the crowd to him again, he said to them, “Listen to me, everyone, and understand.

15.verse: There is nothing from outside a man that enters him that is able to defile him. Rather the things that come out of a man are the things that defile him.”

16.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

17.verse: And when Jesus entered the house away from the crowd, his disciples asked him about the parable.

18.verse: So he said to them, “Are you too so lacking in understanding? Do you not know that whatever comes into a man from outside is not able to defile him,

19.verse: because it does not enter his heart, but his stomach, and goes out into the latrine?” (Thus he declared all foods clean.)

20.verse: And he said, “What comes out of a person, that is what defiles him.

21.verse: For from within, from the heart of a person, come evil plots, immoralities, thefts, murders,

22.verse: adulteries, greedy actions, wicked deeds, deceit, sensuality, selfishness, slander, arrogance, lack of moral sense.

23.verse: All these evil things come from within, and they defile a person.”

24.verse: From there Jesus arose and went to the region of Tyre. He entered a house and wanted no one to know about it, yet he was not able to escape attention.

25.verse: But immediately after hearing of him, a woman whose daughter had an unclean spirit came and fell at his feet.

26.verse: The woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by birth. She begged Jesus to drive out the demon from her daughter.

27.verse: He said to her, “Let the children first be fed, for it is not right to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”

28.verse: But she answered him, saying, “Lord, even the dogs under the table feed from the children’s crumbs.”

29.verse: And he said to her, “Because of this reply, you may go; the demon has left your daughter.”

30.verse: And when she arrived at her house, she found the child lying on the bed, the demon having departed.

31.verse: Departing again from the region of Tyre, Jesus went through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, in the midst of the region of the Decapolis.

32.verse: And they brought to him a deaf man who could hardly speak, and they begged him to lay his hand on him.

33.verse: Taking him aside from the crowd privately, Jesus put his fingers into the man’s ears, and after spitting, he touched his tongue.

34.verse: Looking up to heaven, he gave a deep sigh and said to him, “Ephphatha!” (that is, “Be opened”).

35.verse: And immediately the man’s ears were opened, that which bound his tongue was loosened, and he began to speak clearly.

36.verse: Jesus ordered them to tell no one, but the more he ordered them, the more they spread the news.

37.verse: They were absolutely astonished, saying, “He has done all things well. He makes the deaf to hear and the mute to speak!”

1.verse: In those days, when once again a large crowd had gathered, and not having anything to eat, Jesus called his disciples and said to them,

2.verse: “I have compassion on the crowd, because they have stayed with me three days already and they do not have anything to eat.

3.verse: If I send them to their homes without food, they will faint from exhaustion on the way; and some of them have come from a distance.”

4.verse: And his disciples answered him, “From what source can anyone feed these people with bread here in this desolate place?”

5.verse: And he asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” They said, “Seven.”

6.verse: So he directed the crowd to sit down on the ground. Taking the seven loaves and giving thanks, he broke them and gave them to his disciples to distribute. So they distributed the bread to the crowd.

7.verse: They also had a few small fish. Blessing these, Jesus told them to distribute these as well.

8.verse: And they ate and were filled. And they picked up seven baskets of leftover pieces.

9.verse: There were about four thousand present, and he sent them on their way.

10.verse: And immediately he got into the boat with his disciples and went to the district of Dalmanutha.

11.verse: The Pharisees came and began to argue with him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, testing him.

12.verse: Sighing deeply in his spirit, he said, “Why does this generation seek a sign? I tell you the truth, no sign will be given to this generation.”

13.verse: Then he left them, got into the boat again, and crossed to the other side.

14.verse: Now the disciples had forgotten to take along loaves of bread, except for one loaf they had with them in the boat.

15.verse: And Jesus began to admonish them, saying, “Watch out! Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod!”

16.verse: And they kept discussing with one another the fact that they had no bread.

17.verse: Jesus, aware of this, said to them, “Why are you discussing the fact that you have no bread? Do you not yet perceive or understand? Do you have hardened hearts?

18.verse: Having eyes, do you not see? And having ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember?

19.verse: When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you pick up?” They said to him, “Twelve.”

20.verse: “When I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces did you pick up?” And they said, “Seven.”

21.verse: And he said to them, “Do you not yet understand?”

22.verse: And they came to Bethsaida. And some people brought to him a blind man and begged him to touch him.

23.verse: And taking the hand of the blind man, he led him outside the village. Then, after moistening the eyes of the blind man with saliva and laying his hands on him, Jesus asked him, “What do you see?”

24.verse: Upon regaining his sight, he said, “I see people walking, but I see them as trees.”

25.verse: Then Jesus again put his hands on the man’s eyes, and he saw clearly. His sight was restored, and he saw everything distinctly.

26.verse: And Jesus sent him to his home, saying, “Do not go back into the village.”

27.verse: And Jesus and his disciples went on to the villages of Caesarea Philippi. On the way he questioned his disciples, saying to them, “Who do people say I am?”

28.verse: So they answered him, saying, “John the baptizer; and others, Elijah; but others, one of the prophets.”

29.verse: And he asked them, “But who do you say I am?” Peter answered, saying to him, “You are the Christ.”

30.verse: And he strictly warned them not to tell anyone about him.

31.verse: Then Jesus began to teach them that it was necessary for the Son of Man to suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and the ruling priests and scribes, and be killed and after three days to rise again.

32.verse: And he was speaking openly about this. So Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.

33.verse: But after turning and looking at his disciples, he rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind me, Satan! For you are not thinking the thoughts of God, but those of men.”

34.verse: When he had called the crowd with his disciples, he said to them, “If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself, take up his cross and follow me.

35.verse: For whoever wishes to save his life will lose it, but whoever will lose his life for my sake and that of the gospel will save it.

36.verse: For what does it profit a man to gain the whole world, yet forfeit his life?

37.verse: Or what can a man give in exchange for his life?

38.verse: For whoever is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when he comes in the glory of his Father with his holy angels.”

1.verse: And he said to them, “I tell you the truth, there are some standing here who will not taste death until they see the kingdom of God having come with power.”

2.verse: And after six days Jesus took with him Peter and James and John, and led them up a high mountain by themselves. And he was transfigured before them,

3.verse: and his clothes became radiant, intensely white, as no launderer on earth could bleach them.

4.verse: And Elijah appeared to them with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.

5.verse: And answering, Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good that we are here. Let us make three shelters: one for you and one for Moses and one for Elijah”—

6.verse: for he did not know what he should reply, because they were so frightened.

7.verse: Then a cloud appeared, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, “This is my Son, the beloved, listen to him!”

8.verse: And suddenly, looking around, they no longer saw anyone, but only Jesus with them.

9.verse: And as they were coming down from the mountain, he ordered them not to tell anyone what they had seen, until the Son of Man should rise from the dead.

10.verse: So they kept this saying to themselves, questioning what the “rising of the dead” could mean.

11.verse: And they asked him, saying, “Why do the scribes say, ‘Elijah must come first’?”

12.verse: And he said to them, “Elijah does come first, and restores all things. Yet how is it written about the Son of Man? That he should suffer many things and be treated with contempt?

13.verse: But I tell you that Elijah has come, and they did to him whatever they pleased, just as it is written about him.”

14.verse: And when they came to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them, and scribes arguing with them.

15.verse: And immediately the entire crowd, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running up to him, they greeted him.

16.verse: And he asked them, “What are you arguing about with them?”

17.verse: And one of the crowd answered him, “Teacher, I brought my son to you, who has a mute spirit.

18.verse: And whenever it seizes him, it throws him down, and he foams at the mouth and grinds his teeth and becomes rigid. So I asked your disciples to cast it out, but they were not able.”

19.verse: Answering them he said, “O unbelieving generation! How long must I be with you? How long must I put up with you? Bring him to me.”

20.verse: And they brought the boy to him. And when the spirit saw him, immediately it convulsed him; and falling on the ground, the boy began to roll about, foaming at the mouth.

21.verse: And Jesus asked his father, “How long has this been happening to him?” And he said, “Since childhood;

22.verse: indeed frequently it has even cast him into fire and into water to destroy him. But if you can do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”

23.verse: And Jesus said to him, “‘If you can’! All things are possible for the one who has faith.”

24.verse: Immediately the father of the boy cried out and said, “I believe; help my unbelief!”

25.verse: When Jesus saw that a crowd was quickly gathering, he rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it, “Mute and deaf spirit, I command you, come out of him and never enter him again!”

26.verse: After crying out and convulsing him violently, the spirit came out; and the boy was like a corpse, so that many were saying, “He is dead.”

27.verse: But Jesus, taking him by the hand, lifted him up, and he stood up.

28.verse: And when he had entered the house, his disciples asked him in private, “Why were we not able to cast it out?”

29.verse: And he said to them, “This kind cannot come out except by prayer.”

30.verse: And leaving there, they went on through Galilee. And Jesus did not want anyone to know about it;

31.verse: for he was teaching his disciples and saying to them, “The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men, and they will kill him. Then three days after he has been killed, he will rise.

32.verse: But they did not understand the saying, and they were afraid to ask him.

33.verse: And they came to Capernaum; and when he was in the house, he asked them, “What were you discussing on the way?”

34.verse: But they kept silent, for on the way they had argued among themselves about who was the greatest.

35.verse: And sitting down, he called the twelve and said to them, “If anyone would be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.”

36.verse: And taking a child, he put him in the midst of them, and taking him in his arms, he said to them,

37.verse: “Whoever receives one of these children in my name, receives me; and whoever receives me, receives not me but the one who sent me.”

38.verse: John said to him, “Teacher, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him because he was not following us.”

39.verse: But Jesus said, “Do not stop him, for there is no one who will do a mighty work in my name and be able soon after to speak evil of me.

40.verse: For whoever is not against us is for us.

41.verse: For I tell you the truth, whoever gives you a cup of water to drink because you bear the name of Christ will most certainly not lose his reward.

42.verse: “And whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in me to sin, it would be better for him if a large millstone were hung around his neck and he were thrown into the sea.

43.verse: And if your hand causes you to sin, cut it off; it is better for you to enter into life crippled than having two hands to go to hell, to the unquenchable fire.

44.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

45.verse: And if your foot causes you to sin, cut it off; it is better for you to enter into life lame than having two feet to be cast into hell.

46.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

47.verse: And if your eye causes you to sin, throw it away; it is better for you to enter the kingdom of God having one eye than having two eyes to be cast into hell,

48.verse: where ‘their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.’

49.verse: For everyone will be salted with fire.

50.verse: Salt is good, but if the salt has become unsalty, with what will you make it savory? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”

1.verse: Then Jesus left that place and went to the region of Judea and beyond the Jordan, and crowds gathered around him again. And again, as was his custom, he began to teach them.

2.verse: And Pharisees came up and asked him if it was lawful for a man to divorce his wife, in order to test him.

3.verse: In response he said to them, “What did Moses command you?”

4.verse: They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and to send her away.”

5.verse: But Jesus said to them, “Because of your hardness of heart he wrote this commandment for you.

6.verse: But from the beginning of creation, ‘male and female’ he made them.

7.verse: ‘For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife,

8.verse: and the two shall be one flesh.’ So no longer are they two, but one flesh.

9.verse: Therefore what God has joined together, let not man divide.”

10.verse: And in the house, the disciples were again questioning him about this matter.

11.verse: And he said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery against her.

12.verse: And if she, after divorcing her husband, marries another man, she commits adultery.”

13.verse: And people were bringing to him children so that he could touch them, but his disciples rebuked them.

14.verse: But when Jesus saw it, he was indignant and said to them, “Let the children come to me. Do not prevent them, for of such is the kingdom of God.

15.verse: I tell you the truth, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a child will never enter it.”

16.verse: And taking them into his arms, he blessed them, laying his hands on them.

17.verse: And as he was going out on the road, a man ran up, and kneeling before him, asked him, “Good teacher, what must I do to inherit eternal life?”

18.verse: But Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one—God.

19.verse: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder, Do not commit adultery, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Do not defraud, Honor your father and mother.’”

20.verse: And the man said to him, “Teacher, all these I have kept from my youth.”

21.verse: But Jesus, looking at him, loved him and said to him, “You lack one thing—go, sell whatever you have and give the money to the poor; then you will have treasure in heaven. And come, follow me.”

22.verse: Disheartened by the saying, the man went away grieving; for he had many possessions.

23.verse: And looking around, Jesus said to his disciples, “How difficult it is for those who have wealth to enter the kingdom of God.”

24.verse: The disciples were shocked at his words. But Jesus, responding again, said to them, “Children, how difficult it is to enter the kingdom of God!

25.verse: It is easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.”

26.verse: They were even more astonished, saying to themselves, “Then who is able to be saved?”

27.verse: Looking at them, Jesus said, “With man it is impossible, but not with God; for all things are possible with God.”

28.verse: Peter started to speak to him, “Well, we have left everything and have followed you.”

29.verse: Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, there is no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for my sake and for the sake of the gospel

30.verse: who will not receive one hundredfold now in this present time—houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and fields, with persecutions—and in the coming age, eternal life.

31.verse: But many who are first will be last, and the last will be first.”

32.verse: Now they were on the road, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was going on ahead of them. They were filled with awe, but those who followed behind were afraid. And taking the twelve aside again, he began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him:

33.verse: “Listen, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be handed over to the ruling priests and the scribes, and they will condemn him to death and hand him over to the Gentiles.

34.verse: And they will mock him, and spit on him, and flog him, and kill him; but after three days he will rise.”

35.verse: Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, approached Jesus and said to him, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we ask.”

36.verse: And he said to them, “What do you want me to do for you?”

37.verse: And they said to him, “Give us permission to sit, one on your right and one on your left, in your glory.”

38.verse: But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, or to be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized?”

39.verse: They said to him, “We are able.” And Jesus said to them, “The cup that I drink you will drink, and with the baptism with which I am baptized, you will be baptized;

40.verse: but to sit on my right or on my left is not mine to give, but it is for those for whom it has been prepared.”

41.verse: And hearing this, the ten began to be indignant at James and John.

42.verse: And calling them to him, Jesus said to them, “You know that those who are supposed to rule over the Gentiles lord it over them, and their leaders domineer over them.

43.verse: But it is not to be so among you. But whoever would be great among you must be your servant,

44.verse: and whoever would be first among you must be servant of all.

45.verse: For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

46.verse: And they came to Jericho. And as he was going out from Jericho with his disciples and a considerable crowd, a blind beggar, Bartimaeus the son of Timaeus, was sitting by the road.

47.verse: And hearing that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out and say, “Son of David, Jesus, have mercy on me!”

48.verse: And many were sternly telling him to be quiet; but all the more he kept crying out, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

49.verse: And Jesus stopped and said, “Call him.” And they called the blind man, saying to him, “Take courage! Get up! He is calling you.”

50.verse: And throwing aside his cloak, he jumped to his feet and came to Jesus.

51.verse: And answering him, Jesus said, “What do you want me to do for you?” And the blind man said to him, “Rabbi, that I might see again.”

52.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Go, your faith has healed you.” And immediately he regained his sight and began following him on the way.

1.verse: And when they drew near to Jerusalem, Bethphage, and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, Jesus dispatched two of his disciples

2.verse: and said to them, “Go into the village directly ahead of you, and immediately upon entering it you will find a tethered colt on which no one has ever sat. Untie it and bring it.

3.verse: If anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord has need of it and will send it back here as soon as possible.’”

4.verse: So they went away and found a tethered colt at a door outside in the street, and they untied it.

5.verse: And some of those standing there said to them, “What are you doing, untying the colt?”

6.verse: And they spoke to them just as Jesus had said, and they gave them permission.

7.verse: Then they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their cloaks on it, and he sat on it.

8.verse: And many spread their cloaks on the road, while others spread tall grass, cutting it from the fields.

9.verse: And those who went before and those who followed were crying out, “Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!

10.verse: Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David! Hosanna in the highest!”

11.verse: And he entered Jerusalem and went into the temple. And looking around at everything, the hour already being late, he went out to Bethany with the twelve.

12.verse: And on the next day, when they had left from Bethany, Jesus became hungry.

13.verse: And seeing at a distance a fig tree in leaf, he went to see if he could find anything on it. And when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.

14.verse: So in response he said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!” And his disciples were listening.

15.verse: Then they went into Jerusalem. And entering the temple, he began to drive out those who were selling and those who were buying in the temple; and he overturned the tables of the money changers and the chairs of those who were selling pigeons,

16.verse: and he would not allow anyone to carry merchandise through the temple.

17.verse: And he was teaching and saying to them, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations’? But you have made it ‘a hideout for robbers.’”

18.verse: And the ruling priests and the scribes heard of this and began seeking how they could destroy him, for they feared him, because all the people were impressed by his teaching.

19.verse: And when evening came, they went out of the city.

20.verse: And passing by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered down to the roots.

21.verse: And thinking back, Peter said to him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree that you cursed has withered!”

22.verse: And answering, Jesus said to them, “Have faith in God.

23.verse: I tell you the truth, that if anyone says to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and does not waver in his heart but believes that what he says will happen, it will be done for him.

24.verse: For this reason I tell you, whatever you pray and ask for, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.

25.verse: And whenever you stand praying, forgive if you have something against someone, so that your Father in heaven may also forgive you your transgressions.”

26.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

27.verse: And they came again to Jerusalem. And while he was walking about in the temple, the ruling priests and the scribes and the elders came to him,

28.verse: and were asking him, “By what authority are you doing these things?” and, “Who gave you this authority to do these things?”

29.verse: But Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one thing; answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

30.verse: The baptism of John—was it from heaven or from man? Answer me!”

31.verse: So they discussed it among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’

32.verse: But if we say, ‘From man’—(they were afraid of the people, for everyone considered that John was truly a prophet).

33.verse: So in answer to Jesus, they said, “We do not know.” And Jesus said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.”

1.verse: And he began to speak to them in parables. “A man planted a vineyard and put a fence around it. He dug a pit for the winepress and built a tower; then he leased it out to tenant farmers and went on a journey.

2.verse: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenant farmers to receive from the farmers a portion of the fruit from the vineyard.

3.verse: But they took him and beat him and sent him away empty-handed.

4.verse: And again he sent to them another servant; and that one they struck on the head and treated dishonorably.

5.verse: So he sent another; and that one they killed—and so with many others, beating some and killing others.

6.verse: He had still one other, a beloved son. He sent him last to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’

7.verse: But those tenants said to themselves, ‘This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’

8.verse: And taking him, they killed him and threw him out of the vineyard.

9.verse: What therefore will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the tenants and give the vineyard to others.

10.verse: Have you not even read this scripture: ‘The stone that the builders rejected has become the capstone;

11.verse: this came about from the Lord, and it is marvelous in our eyes’?”

12.verse: And they were seeking to arrest him, but feared the people, for they knew that he had spoken the parable against them. So they left him and went away.

13.verse: And they sent to him some of the Pharisees and some of the Herodians to trap him with a statement.

14.verse: When they came they said to him, “Teacher, we know that you are truthful and that the opinion of another is of no concern to you. For you do not regard the position of men, but you truly teach the way of God. Is it lawful to pay tax to Caesar, or not? Should we pay or should we not pay?”

15.verse: But knowing their hypocrisy, he said to them, “Why do you test me? Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.”

16.verse: So they brought one. And he said to them, “Of whom is this likeness and inscription?” And they said to him, “Caesar.”

17.verse: Jesus said to them, “Give to Caesar what belongs to Caesar, but give to God what belongs to God.” And they were amazed at him.

18.verse: And the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him, and they were questioning him, saying,

19.verse: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if someone’s brother should die and leave behind a wife, but not leave behind a child, that his brother should take the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.

20.verse: There were seven brothers; the first took a wife, and when he died he left no offspring.

21.verse: Then the second brother took her, and he died, leaving behind no offspring. And the third likewise.

22.verse: And the seven did not leave offspring. Last of all the woman also died.

23.verse: In the resurrection, when they rise again, of which of them will she be wife? For all seven had her as wife.”

24.verse: Jesus said to them, “Are you not mistaken for this reason, that you know neither the scriptures nor the power of God?

25.verse: For when people rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are they given in marriage, but they are as angels in heaven.

26.verse: But concerning the dead, that they are raised, have you not read in the book of Moses in the passage about the bush, how God spoke to him saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob’?

27.verse: He is not God of the dead, but of the living. You are greatly mistaken!”

28.verse: And one of the scribes came up and heard them disputing. Seeing how well Jesus had answered them, he put this question to him: “Which commandment is the most important of all?”

29.verse: Jesus answered, “The most important is, ‘Hear, Israel, the Lord our God, the Lord is one;

30.verse: and you shall love the Lord your God with your whole heart, and with your whole life, and with your whole mind, and with your whole strength.’

31.verse: The second is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”

32.verse: And the scribe said to him, “Well said, teacher. You have spoken truthfully; ‘he is one, and there is no other besides him.’

33.verse: And ‘to love him with the whole heart, and with the whole understanding, and with the whole strength,’ and ‘to love one’s neighbor as oneself,’ is much more than all whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”

34.verse: And Jesus, seeing that the scribe had answered wisely, said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” And no one dared to question him any more.

35.verse: While Jesus was teaching in the temple, he said, “How can the scribes say that Messiah is the son of David?

36.verse: David himself, by the Holy Spirit, said, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I put your enemies beneath your feet.”’

37.verse: David himself calls him ‘Lord,’ so how can he be his son?” And the large crowd was listening to him with delight.

38.verse: And in his teaching he was saying, “Beware of the scribes, who like to parade around in flowing robes, and want greetings in the marketplaces

39.verse: and the front seats in the synagogues, and the places of honor at banquets.

40.verse: They devour the property of widows and, as a show, offer up long prayers. These men will receive a more severe judgment.”

41.verse: And taking a seat opposite the treasury, he was watching how the people were putting money into the offering box. Many rich people were putting in large sums.

42.verse: A poor widow approached and put in two small coins, about a penny.

43.verse: And he called his disciples to him and said to them, “I tell you the truth, this poor widow has put in more than all those who are putting large amounts into the offering box.

44.verse: For they all put in from their abundance, but she from her need has put in everything she had—all she had to live on.”

1.verse: And as he went out of the temple, one of his disciples said to him, “Teacher, look, what massive stones and what magnificent buildings!”

2.verse: And Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not a single stone will be left here resting on another that will not be thrown down.”

3.verse: So while he was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew questioned him privately.

4.verse: “Tell us, when will these things be, and what will be the sign when all these things are about to take place?”

5.verse: And Jesus began to speak to them, “Watch out lest someone mislead you.

6.verse: Many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am he,’ and they will deceive many.

7.verse: And when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed; those things must happen, but the end is not yet.

8.verse: For nation will rise against nation and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places; there will be famines. These are the beginning of birth pains.

9.verse: But watch out for yourselves; they will deliver you over to local councils, and in synagogues you will be beaten, and before governors and kings you will be made to stand for my sake, to bear witness to them.

10.verse: First the gospel must be preached to every nation.

11.verse: And when they bring you to trial and deliver you over, do not worry ahead of time what you should say, but whatever is given you in that hour, speak; for you are not the ones who will be speaking, but the Holy Spirit.

12.verse: And brother will deliver over brother to death, and a father his child; and children will rise up in rebellion against parents and have them put to death.

13.verse: And you will be hated by all on account of my name. But the one who perseveres to the end will be saved.

14.verse: “When you see the ‘abomination of desolation’ standing where he should not be (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

15.verse: Let the one who is on the housetop not come down, nor enter his house to remove anything from it;

16.verse: and let the one who is in the field not return to get his cloak.

17.verse: But woe to those women who are pregnant and to those who are nursing in those days.

18.verse: And pray that it may not happen during winter,

19.verse: because those will be days of such tribulation as has never happened from the beginning of creation, which God created, until now, nor ever will be.

20.verse: And unless the Lord had cut short the number of days, no one would survive; but on account of the elect, whom he chose, he cut short the days.

21.verse: And then if someone should say to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, there he is!’—do not believe it.

22.verse: For false christs and false prophets will arise and will offer signs and wonders in order to deceive, if possible, the elect.

23.verse: But you, beware; I have told you all this in advance.

24.verse: But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light,

25.verse: and the stars will be falling from heaven, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.

26.verse: And then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds, with great power and glory.

27.verse: And at that time he will send his angels, and will gather his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of heaven.

28.verse: “Now from the fig tree learn its parable: As soon as its bough becomes tender and puts out its leaves, you know that summer is near.

29.verse: So also, when you see these things taking place, you know that he is near, at the gates.

30.verse: I tell you the truth, this generation will not pass away until all these things begin to take place.

31.verse: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

32.verse: But of that day or hour no one knows, neither the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

33.verse: Watch out, be alert, for you do not know when the time will come.

34.verse: It is like a man going on a journey. He left his home and gave authority to his servants, to each one his work, and he ordered the doorkeeper to stay alert.

35.verse: So stay alert—for you do not know when the master of the house will return, whether in the evening, or at midnight, or at cock crowing, or toward daybreak—

36.verse: lest coming suddenly he should find you sleeping.

37.verse: And what I say to you, I say to all: Stay alert!”

1.verse: It was now two days before the Passover and Festival of Unleavened Bread. And the ruling priests and the scribes were seeking how to seize him by treachery and put him to death,

2.verse: but they were saying, “Not during the festival, lest there be an uproar among the people.”

3.verse: And while he was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he reclined at table, there came a woman with an alabaster flask of very costly anointment of pure nard; and breaking the flask, she poured it over his head.

4.verse: But some were indignant, and began saying to themselves, “For what purpose was this waste of ointment?

5.verse: For this ointment could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor.” And they rebuked her harshly.

6.verse: But Jesus said, “Leave her alone. Why are you causing her trouble? She has done a beautiful thing to me.

7.verse: For you will always have the poor with you, and whenever you want you can do something good for them, but you will not always have me.

8.verse: She has done what she could; she has anointed my body beforehand for burial.

9.verse: I tell you the truth, wherever the gospel is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be told in memory of her.”

10.verse: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the ruling priests so he might hand Jesus over to them.

11.verse: And when they heard it, they were pleased and promised to give him money. So Judas was seeking how he might hand him over at a convenient moment.

12.verse: And on the first day of Unleavened Bread, when people were slaughtering the Passover lamb, his disciples said to him, “Where do you want us to go and prepare for you to eat the Passover?”

13.verse: And he sent two of his disciples and said to them, “Go into the city and a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you; follow him.

14.verse: And wherever he enters, say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is my guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’

15.verse: And he will show you a large upper room, furnished and ready; there prepare for us.”

16.verse: The disciples left, came to the city, and found things just as he had told them. So they prepared the Passover.

17.verse: And when it was evening, he came with the twelve.

18.verse: And while they were reclining at table and eating, Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, one of you will betray me, one who is eating with me.”

19.verse: They began to be grieved and to say to him one after the other, “Surely not I?”

20.verse: He said to them, “It is one of the twelve, one who is dipping his bread into the bowl with me.

21.verse: For the Son of Man is going as it is written of him; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed—better for him if that man had not been born.”

22.verse: And while they were eating, he took bread, and after giving thanks he broke it and gave it to them and said, “Take; this is my body.”

23.verse: And when he had taken the cup and given thanks, he passed it to them, and they all drank from it.

24.verse: And he said to them, “This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out in behalf of many.

25.verse: I tell you the truth, I will not again drink from the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”

26.verse: Then after singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

27.verse: And Jesus said to them, “All of you will fall away, because it is written, ‘I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.’

28.verse: But after I am raised up, I will go on ahead of you into Galilee.”

29.verse: Peter said to him, “Even though they all fall away, I will not!”

30.verse: And Jesus said to him, “I tell you the truth, today—this very night, before the rooster crows twice—you will deny me three times.”

31.verse: But Peter exclaimed vehemently, “Even if I must die with you, I will never deny you!” And all the others repeated the same thing.

32.verse: And they went to a place that was named Gethsemane; and he said to his disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”

33.verse: And he took along Peter and James and John with him, and began to be distressed and troubled.

34.verse: And he said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to the point of death; remain here and stay alert.”

35.verse: And going on a little farther, he fell to the ground and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass him by.

36.verse: And he said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible for you. Remove this cup from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.”

37.verse: Then he returned and found them sleeping. So he said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Were you not able to stay alert for one hour?”

38.verse: Stay alert and pray so that you will not come into temptation; the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak.”

39.verse: And again, going away, he prayed, saying the same thing.

40.verse: And again, returning, he found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy, and they did not know how they should answer him.

41.verse: And he returned a third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and taking your rest? Enough! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of sinners.

42.verse: Get up, let us be on our way; see, my betrayer has arrived.”

43.verse: And immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, appeared, and with him a crowd with swords and clubs, from the ruling priests and the scribes and the elders.

44.verse: Now his betrayer had given them a sign, saying, “The one I will kiss, it is he. Seize him and lead him away under guard.”

45.verse: And when Judas arrived, immediately he went up to Jesus and said, “Rabbi!” And he kissed him.

46.verse: And they laid hands on him and seized him.

47.verse: But one of those standing by, having drawn his sword, struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his ear.

48.verse: And responding, Jesus said to them, “As against a robber have you come out with swords and clubs to take me?

49.verse: Daily I was with you in the temple, teaching, and you did not seize me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”

50.verse: And leaving him, they all fled.

51.verse: And a certain young man was following him, with a linen cloth wrapped around his naked body; and they tried to seize him,

52.verse: but leaving behind the linen cloth, he ran away naked

53.verse: And they led Jesus to the high priest; and all the ruling priests and the elders and the scribes came together.

54.verse: And Peter followed him from a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest, and he was sitting with the officers and warming himself at the fire.

55.verse: Now the ruling priests and the entire council were seeking testimony against Jesus to put him to death, but they were not finding any.

56.verse: For many were giving false testimony against him, but their testimonies were not in agreement.

57.verse: And some, standing up, were giving false testimony against him, saying,

58.verse: “We heard him saying, ‘I will destroy this temple made with hands, and in three days I will build another not made with hands.’”

59.verse: Yet not even about this was their testimony in agreement.

60.verse: Then the high priest, standing up in their midst, asked Jesus, saying, “Are you not going to reply to what these men are testifying against you?”

61.verse: But he remained silent and answered back nothing. Again the high priest questioned him and said to him, “Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed?”

62.verse: And Jesus said, “I am; and you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power and coming with the clouds of heaven.”

63.verse: And the high priest, tearing his garments, said, “Why do we still have need of witnesses?

64.verse: You have heard the blasphemy! What appears to be right to you?” And they all condemned him as deserving death.

65.verse: And some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to strike him, and to say to him, “Prophesy!” Even the officers received him with slaps to the face.

66.verse: And while Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the maid servants of the high priest came by,

67.verse: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked closely at him and said, “You also were with the Nazarene, Jesus.”

68.verse: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you are saying.” And he went out into the exterior court, and a rooster crowed.

69.verse: And the maid servant, seeing him, began again to say to those who were standing around, “This man is one of them.”

70.verse: But again he denied it. And after a little while again those standing around said to Peter, “Surely you are one of them, for you also are a Galilean.”

71.verse: Then Peter began to call down curses on himself and to swear, “I do not know this man of whom you speak!”

72.verse: And immediately the rooster crowed a second time. Then Peter remembered the word that Jesus had said to him, “Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.” And upon reflection, he broke into tears.

1.verse: As soon as it was morning, the ruling priests, after holding a consultation with the elders and scribes and the entire council, bound Jesus, led him away, and handed him over to Pilate.

2.verse: And Pilate questioned him, “Are you the king of the Jews?” And answering him, he said, “You say it.”

3.verse: And the ruling priests accused him repeatedly.

4.verse: Then Pilate questioned him again, saying, “Do you answer nothing? See how many accusations they are bringing against you.”

5.verse: But Jesus no longer gave any reply, so that Pilate was amazed.

6.verse: Now at the feast he used to release to them one prisoner whom they requested.

7.verse: Among the rebels in prison, who in the insurrection had committed murder, there was a man called Barabbas.

8.verse: And coming up, the crowd began to ask Pilate to do as he usually did for them.

9.verse: So Pilate responded to them, saying, “Do you want me to release to you the king of the Jews?”

10.verse: For he knew that the ruling priests had handed Jesus over out of envy.

11.verse: But the ruling priests stirred up the crowd so that Pilate would release Barabbas to them instead.

12.verse: And Pilate, answering again said to them, “What, then, do you want me to do with the man you call the king of the Jews?”

13.verse: But again they cried out, “Crucify him!”

14.verse: And Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has he done?” But they cried out all the more, “Crucify him!”

15.verse: So Pilate, wishing to satisfy the crowd, released to them Barabbas; and having scourged Jesus, he handed him over to be crucified.

16.verse: And the soldiers led him away into the palace (that is, the praetorium) and they called together the whole company of soldiers.

17.verse: And they clothed him in purple; and twisting some thorns into a crown, they placed it on him.

18.verse: Then they began to greet him, “Hail, king of the Jews!”

19.verse: And they kept striking his head with a staff and spitting on him; and falling to their knees, they paid homage to him.

20.verse: And when they had finished mocking him, they stripped him of the purple robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.

21.verse: And they conscripted a certain passerby, Simon of Cyrene (the father of Alexander and Rufus), as he was coming in from the country, to bear his cross.

22.verse: And they brought him to the place Golgotha, (which means, Place of the Skull).

23.verse: And they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he would not take it.

24.verse: Then they crucified him and divided his clothing, casting lots for them, to see who would take what.

25.verse: It was the third hour, and they crucified him.

26.verse: And the inscription giving the accusation against him read, “The King of the Jews.”

27.verse: And with him they crucified two robbers, one on his right and one on his left.

28.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

29.verse: And those passing by ridiculed him, wagging their heads, and saying, “Aha! You who would destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days,

30.verse: come down from the cross and save yourself.”
