31.verse: So also the ruling priests, mocking among themselves, with the scribes, were saying, “Others he saved; himself he can not save!

32.verse: Let the Christ, the king of Israel come down now from the cross, so that we may see and believe.” And those crucified with him were reviling him.

33.verse: And when the sixth hour had come, darkness fell over the whole land until the ninth hour.

34.verse: And at the ninth hour, Jesus cried with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why did you forsake me?”

35.verse: And when some of the bystanders heard this, they said, “Listen, he is calling Elijah!”

36.verse: Then someone ran, filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a staff, and gave it to him to drink, saying, “Permit me; let us see if Elijah will come to take him down.”

37.verse: And Jesus, uttering a loud cry, breathed his last.

38.verse: And the veil of the temple was torn in two, from top to bottom.

39.verse: And when the centurion, who was standing in front of him, saw that in this way he had died, he said, “Truly, this man was the son of God!”

40.verse: There were also women there, watching from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome,

41.verse: who, when he was in Galilee, used to follow him and care for his needs; and many other women were there who had come up with him to Jerusalem.

42.verse: And when evening had already come, since it was the day of Preparation (that is, the day before the Sabbath),

43.verse: Joseph of Arimathea, a respected member of the council, who also himself was expecting the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.

44.verse: Pilate was surprised that he was already dead, so summoning the centurion, he asked him if he had been dead for a long time.

45.verse: And learning from the centurion that he was dead, he gave the corpse to Joseph.

46.verse: So he brought a linen shroud, and taking him down, he wrapped him in the linen shroud and laid him in a tomb, which had been hewn out of rock; and he rolled a stone across the entrance of the tomb.

47.verse: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses were watching closely where he was laid.

1.verse: And when the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices so that they might go and anoint him.

2.verse: Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb, the sun having risen.

3.verse: And they were saying to themselves, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance of the tomb?”

4.verse: And looking up, they saw that the stone had been rolled away—for it was very large.

5.verse: And entering the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right, dressed in a white robe, and they were alarmed.

6.verse: But he said to them, “Do not be alarmed. You seek Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has been raised. He is not here. Look, there is the place where they laid him.

7.verse: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, ‘He is going before you into Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.’”

8.verse: And going outside, they fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had taken hold of them. And they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.

9.verse: Now when Jesus arose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

10.verse: She went out and reported to those who had been with him, as they were mourning and weeping.

11.verse: And when they heard that he was alive and had been seen by her, they refused to believe it.

12.verse: After this, he appeared in another form to two of them as they were walking along, going into the country.

13.verse: And when they returned, they reported it to the others; but they refused to believe them.

14.verse: Later he appeared to the eleven themselves as they were reclining at table; and he reproached their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they had refused to believe those who had seen him resurrected.

15.verse: And he said to them, “Go into all the world and proclaim the gospel to every creature.

16.verse: The one who believes and is baptized will be saved, but the one who refuses to believe will be condemned.

17.verse: And these signs will accompany those who believe: in my name they will cast out demons; they will speak in new tongues;

18.verse: with their hands they will pick up snakes; and if they drink any deadly poison it will in no way harm them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”

19.verse: Then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken to them, was taken up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.

20.verse: And going out, they proclaimed everywhere, while the Lord worked alongside and confirmed the message through the accompanying signs.
